articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Sin Kyong Hak
Commitment to Struggle for Checking Expansion of U.S. Military Base in S. Korea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Sin Kyong Hak 
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il on May 2 sent a wreath to the bier of People's Artiste Sin Kyong Hak, conductor of the Mansudae Art Troupe, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Congratulations to Egyptian President
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Egyptian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Egyptian President 
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a congratulatory message to Egyptian President Mohamed Hosni Mubarak on his 78th birthday on May 3.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Egypt would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too, the message wished the president good health and happiness and greater success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country and the fair and comprehensive settlement of the Mideast issue.

articles.title: Young Salmons Go to Sea
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Egyptian President 
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Egyptian President Mohamed Hosni Mubarak on his 78th birthday.
 Expressing the conviction that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too, the message wholeheartedly wished him good health and happiness.

articles.title: Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Young Salmons Go to Sea 
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The Tonghae (East Sea) Fishery Research Institute of the Branch Academy of Fishery Science under the State Academy of Sciences of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea released hundreds of thousands of young salmons in the River Susong recently.
 The young salmons are healthy and going to sea in shoals.    
 Researchers of the institute breed hundreds of thousands of salmon fry every year.
 They have made a research into hatching of salmon at an artificial incubation pond from five years ago.    
 They also succeeded in developing a new technology such as egg fertilization and incubation for artificial proliferation of salmon to suit the local actual conditions.
 They are now extensively increasing parent salmons, thus opening up a prospect for breeding salmons in rivers and seas.

articles.title: Relations of Friendship Cities Established
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK 
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A new stamp has been published in the DPRK to commemorate the 70th anniversary of the foundation of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland (ARF).
 President Kim Il Sung convened the inaugural meeting for the ARF in Donggang, Fusong County, China in May Juche 25 (1936) during the anti-Japanese armed struggle. 
 The association, the first nationwide anti-Japanese united front body in the country, knitted together broad sections of patriotic forces including workers and peasants and aroused them to the struggle against the brigandish Japanese imperialists and thus played a great role in achieving the liberation of the country.    
 Printed on the upper part of the stamp are the words "In Commemoration of the 70th Anniversary of the ARF" and "Juche 25(1936)-Juche 95(2006)". Reflected on the stamp is the front cover of the inaugural declaration of the ARF authored by the President.
 The stamp also figures the secret camp in Donggang, the venue of the inaugural meeting, and a tree bearing the slogan "Long Live the ARF".    
 The face value of the stamp is 3 won.

articles.title: Credentials of Sri Lankan Ambassador to DPRK Presented
China Donates Equipment and Materials to DPRK
articles.content:
Credentials of Sri Lankan Ambassador to DPRK Presented 
    Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Sri Lankan Ambassador E.P. to the DPRK Nihal Rodrigo presented his credentials to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday. 
 On hand were Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and a member of the Sri Lankan embassy.    
 After receiving the credentials the president had a conversation with the ambassador.
